resources.string: Since discriminate is negative, the equation has no solution.
Hi, I use application Quadratic equation:
(* click on the name of the item in the content to go to the appropriate help section)
The Standard Form of a Quadratic Equation looks like this:
To solve the equation, enter the coefficients a, b and —Å in the appropriate fields and click \"Solve\", as shown in image 1.
If you leave the input field empty, as the values of the application will use the 0 (see image 2). Therefore, the application solves square and linear equation of any kind.
To enter negative values, use the button \"minus\". Look for examples of different types of keyboards.\nFor the keyboard, as shown in image 3, you should press the button twice.
For the keyboard, as shown in image 4, simply press the minus button.
The result should look like this:
To enter a fractional value use the button "point". See the examples below (image 6) (image 7).
If you enjoy Quadratic equation, would you mind taking a moment to rate it?\u000AThanks for your support!
Solving the quadratic equation by discriminant
Solving the quadratic equation by Vieta`s formulas
Since the roots are not whole numbers, the solving by the Vieta theorem inappropriate.
Since the equation is not reduced, the solving by the Vieta theorem inappropriate.
The multiple of the roots - a positive number. This means that the roots of the same sign.
\u0020Since the sum of the roots is also positive, both roots of the equation - the positive.
\u0020Since the sum of the roots is negative number, both roots of the equation - the negative.
The multiple of the roots - a negative number, it means that roots have different signs.
\u0020Since the sum of the roots is a positive number, the higher modulus root is a positive number.
\u0020Since the sum of the roots is a negative number, the higher modulus root is a negative number.

Answer: the equation has no solution.
In new version of the application zero can be entered. Now the application solves linear and quadratic equations of any kind.
